item.title: Image Quality Sankey
item.description: # Library library(networkD3) library(dplyr) library(tibble) library(tidyverse) Sankey chart on process from creating a chart image to saving output links4 <- read.csv("../../data/2020-07-19-links.csv") nodes4 <- read.csv("../../data/2020-07-19-nodes.csv") Creating the chart r <- sankeyNetwork( Links = links4, Nodes = nodes4, Source = "IDsource", Target = "IDtarget", Value = "value", NodeID = "name", sinksRight=FALSE ) # add the names back into the links data because sankeyNetwork strips it out r$x$links$name <- links4$name # add onRender JavaScript to set the title to the value of 'name' for each link r <- htmlwidgets::onRender( r, ' function(el, x) { d3.

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds. Instagram Simple Shortcode YouTube Privacy Enhanced Shortcode Twitter Simple Shortcode “In addition to being more logical, asymmetry has the advantage that its complete appearance is far more optically effective than symmetry.” — Jan Tschichold pic.twitter.com/gcv7SrhvJb — Graphic Design History (@DesignReviewed) January 17, 2019 Vimeo Simple Shortcode .

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
